parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.16

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Curator

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns curator logic to which given player has access.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getAssignedCuratorLogic''' player

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> player: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>([[getAssignedCuratorLogic]] [[player]]) [[removeCuratorEditableObjects]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[allDead]],[[true]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allCurators]], [[getAssignedCuratorUnit]]
</value></part></template>


<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 17, 2014 - 17:04 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:SilentSpike|SilentSpike]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command will return [[objNull]] if used immediately after the curator logic is assigned to the unit in question (this includes at mission time 0). To avoid problems use the following beforehand: <code>[[waitUntil]] {![[isNull]] ([[getAssignedCuratorLogic]] unit)};</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
